name: The Ritz-Carlton Cleveland

reviews.text: While this property was not at the same standard as other RC properties in larger cities in the US or abroad, it was quite nice and a terrific value. For the money, staying here was a treat. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Furniture was in good condition. Common areas had classic decor. Good location - a comfortable walk from the waterfront and the R&R HoF. Adjacent to a mall and trains. Conference rooms and food service were good. Staff was very friendly. Room service of good caliber.
reviews.title: Good Value

reviews.text: We spent one night at the Ritz in Cleveland and were thrilled with all aspects of the hotel. Our rooms were large, comfortable and perfect for a family. We had adjoining rooms on the Conceierge floor which was a huge plus traveling with kids. The daily presentations and service were perfect. The pool is small - but perfect for a quick dip before dinner. We ate in the hotel dining room and it did not disappoint either. Overall - exactly what you expect from a Ritz!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Cleveland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A couple of blips and bumps with our stay but staff was compensatory in resolving issues. We voiced our concerns and not a minuted was wasted to meet our expectations. Restful bed and bedding, comforting cleanliness, fresh decor. Room a little small and out-of-the way for a slow Sunday evening. Enjoyed walking out from the hotel to nearby dinner choice.
reviews.title: Location, Amenities and Service met our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My "descent into hell" began with an abrasive phone reservation. Expecting a good experience, as I have had at many Ritz-Carltons, I inquired about specials. I was treated rudely, as if I had shown up bargaining for a ring at Tiffany's. I brushed it off; everyone has a bad day. Unfortunately, this was just an opening act.
reviews.title: Worst Experience Ever! Hotel Hell!

reviews.text: Later I called back. After reviewing my reservation, it turned out that either I had miscommunicated (a real possibility!) or the agent had misstated. I said that it could clearly be my fault, but was requesting an earlier night. The agent said that the rate could not be had now and was $50 higher. I asked if they were really that stuck on the $50 and they were. I told the agent that I would simply use that as an opportunity to explore something else in Cleveland.
reviews.title: I had a great stay!
Cleveland can do better
reviews.text: To encourage fellow travelers why they should vacation in Cleveland, and stay at this hotel in particular, the Ritz-Carlton chain should not lower its standards - just because we are in Cleveland - but should be striving towards the greatness of other, world-class Ritz hotels throughout the country. Travel guides that give this hotel four stars should revisit and rethink the praise. This hotel to me should be rated a three star, with an asterik stating 'hotel in need of vast improvements'.

reviews.title: Ritz Carlton - Enjoyable Stay
reviews.text: We had booked a king-sized bed/room back in March as we were attending a sold-out concert the evening of our stay. The performers for the evening were also staying in the hotel, and while this was fun to see, it made us feel left out and unimportant by the hotel staff. Elevators were 'out of service' to the other guests staying at the Ritz for the convenience of the celebrities, and we had to wait in long lines for the only other elevator.

Calls to the front desk, concierge, and room service went completely unanswered at times. We were initially given a disabled room, lots of bars and grips in the bathroom, and as my husband and I are not disabled, we asked for another room. No king-sized rooms were left, so after a heated argument with a manager, we were shown to the only other room available, which had a large, disgusting brown stain between the two beds, room 1006, to be exact. The cleaner, or fragrant spray the hotel uses to mask odors was overdone to me and did not help the overall musty smell lingering in the rooms and hallways. Carpet and cloth furniture in rooms and hallways seemed to be unchanged from the 80's. Very disappointing rooms for the price. Time for an update, time for a complete renovation here.
reviews.title: Wonderful staff.

reviews.text: Rooms service especially sad after the concert. We were told about 45 minutes or less time-wise until delivery, but after an hour and a half wait with no call or reason given for the delay, the front desk, (whom we called repeatedly and never picked-up forcing my husband at 2am to confront in person) could offer no help in the matter, other than to tell us maybe the mini-bar would suffice as they were sorry, but extremely busy. Room service never came to our room or called. We can only attribute our lack of service and treatment to being labeled as difficult guests.
reviews.title: Nice
Excellent with every visit
reviews.text: We paid over $300 for the room and almost left in the middle of the night to drive home, so unhappy with the hotel and staff after such a fabulous concert. The next morning we pulled another manager aside and tried to explain things to her. She was most helpful and seemed upset that we were and took a hundred dollars off our bill, but the experience stays with you, it cannot be erased no matter how much money comes off the final bill, we booked the room to avoid all that and have a night worth remembering, so while the concert itself will stay with us forever, I'm hoping to quickly forget my stay at the Cleveland Ritz-Carlton, and we will not be returing anytime soon.

reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.text: I guess when I think Ritz Carlton, I'm expecting the best of the best. The public areas of the hotel (the pool, spa, lobby, meeting areas) are all beautiful and top-notch. The room was comfortable but nothing to write home about. I stayed here on business travel, so I figured I'd take advantage of the opportunity to stay at a Ritz Carlton. If I had to pay for it myself, I don't know if it would be worth the price. On the plus side, it is very convenient to everything in downtown Cleveland and adjacent to a mall.
reviews.title: Good, but not Great

reviews.text: I am writing this after having spent two nights at the Ritz-Carlton Cleveland. I would definitely stay in Ritz-Carltons again based on my recent experiences at two of them (Cleveland and New Orleans) and would return to this hotel again (and I am a fussy New Yorker). Here are the pros and cons of the one in Cleveland. PROS: (1) quite good, cheery, energetic, friendly, competent and responsive service, (2) a nice Club level serving small but tasty appetizers throughout the day, which is wonderful alternative to room service if you are dieting, pressed for time, or want to try many different foods rather than commiting to one oversized room service entree, (3) a nice spa with a pool, jacuzzi etc., (4) convenient location in Downtown, (5) VERY comfortable beds and bedding- one of the most comfortable I have ever slept in in a 5 star hotel. CONS: (1) decor in the room I had was a little stodgy and could use an upgrade, (2) music in the pool area was not my taste and could not be changed or turned off even when requested, (3) the non-lake view rooms have industrial views, (4) lighting was a little low for my taste. It is not the place to go for a honeymoon in my opinion, but it added to my favorable impression of Ritz-Carlton.
reviews.title: Positives and Negatives

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for a one-night getaway on December 18th. Check-in was quick and easy. Our room was a nice size on the 10th floor with a downtown view and partial view of Lake Erie. We enjoyed cocktails in the lobby lounge. My husband arranged a romance package so after an excellent dinner at the hotel restaurant, The Muse, we returned to our room to find rose petals in the shape of a heart on the bed. Chocolate dipped strawberries and champagne as well as candles completed the package. It was lovely. The bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We took advantage of the complimentary use of the pool, whirlpool, sauna, and steam rooms. The entire pool/spa area was very clean and relaxing. In the morning, we had the American breakfast delivered to our room. It was DELICIOUS. The coffee was some of the best I've had. Overall, the staff was very friendly and everyone called us by name. The hotel is connected to Tower City Mall and within walking distance to the Quicken Loans Arena (formerly Gund Arena) and Jacobs Field. We would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at this Hotel on a recent business trip. Enjoyed the bar and restaurant MUSE and the great staff. Property is adjacent to a shopping mall with places to eat and a cinema. And the beds and sheets are the most comfortable that I can remember. Good meeting rooms also.
reviews.title: Great Hotel-Professional Staff

reviews.text: I'm not a princess. I'm a typical Marriott customer who decided to try the Ritz because their weekend package was in line with Marriott prices. The double bed I slept in had wonderful linens and a soft fetherbed, but the mattress sagged. You can't cover up a poor foundation. Otherwise, the room was nice and the bathroom was much larger than most hotels. It may have been a while since it was redecorated, but it still was elegant. We really liked the steam room, sauna, pool, and whrlpool. It felt great after watching an athletic event in the cold and rain. Water bottles and apples were a nice touch. Staff were plentiful and very helpful. This is the area where they really shine. They allowed us to trade the two tickets included in our package for 2 additional breakfaxts. We had paid for the self-park package, but they offered valet parking and the valets were quick. Breakfast at the Century restaurant was a disaster. We weren't offered coffee until we'd been seated about 7 minutes. I knocked over my cup of coffee (definately not a princess move) while the waiter was taking my order. He didn't do a thing about it; no effort to clean it up, or bring me another cup of coffee. Luckily the thick tablecloth soaked it up. Towards the end of the meal, the waiter knocked over my husband's cup of coffee. Thank heavens for that thick tablecloth. We noticed them dumping cartons of orange juice into pitchers. The menu only listed "fresh squeezed orange juice". Amazing what you can get for $4. We did learn that the Century restaurant was closing that day and will reopen as something else. Let's hope that waiter is gone.
reviews.title: Princess and the Pea

likes.liked: — Most of the staff members were very helful.
likes.disliked: — the mattress in our room and the waiter in the restaurant

reviews.title: What a Great Hotel
reviews.text: Wow! What an incredible hotel and a friendly and inviting staff. The club lounge with different food througout the day is worth the money. I would definitely go back and stay again.

reviews.title: Trip Advisor was right!
reviews.text: Having just returned from a disappointing stay at the Ritz, I feel compelled to write my first advisory. This property certainly isn't up to Ritz standards. Check in was uneventful...with the exception that staff seemed bored and there was no doorman or bellman to assist with bags. The room was standard with two skimpy pillows. The bed was comfortable. We were disappointed to return to the room after our meeting to find only one bed made up. The smell in the hall each morning reminded me of car exhaust. The flowers in the lobby were lovely, but the ones in the hall had dirty water when we arrived.
I do appreciate the services of the conceriege and the excellent dining recommendations. And the water and towels for joggers in the a.m.
reviews.title: Loved it!
Ritz-Carlton Corp's second tier
reviews.text: With a little work, this would be up to RC standards.

I am a big fan of The Ritz and will only stay there when traveling. They just have the routine down perfectly. The rooms are classy and welcoming. The staff is warm and friendly. And they go out of their way to make you feel at home. I can't think of anything else I'd want out of a hotel.
reviews.title: A nice hotel but not nearly what I would expect from RC

reviews.text: I can't imagine how any previous guests could complain about this hotel. The staff is extraorindarily friendly; the bed was extremely comfortable; the heated pool and whirlpool were very enjoyable; the fitness center is small but luxurious, and their restaurant has great food and one night they featured the best local singer I have ever heard -- Laura Varcho. Hope she goes far. Cleveland itself is a bit of a ghost town and somewhat depressing but staying at the Ritz makes it all much more bearable!
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: I stayed at the Ritz when it first opened and again recently. It's one of a handful of five-star hotels in Ohio (there are none outside the Northeast Ohio region).
reviews.title: One of the best hotels in Ohio
Over Rated
reviews.text: For flashy oppulence, I think the new Inter-Continental in Cleveland wins (not the other one in Cleveland, which is an all-suite hotel). But the Ritz holds true to its atmosphere of understated elegance, which some may confuse as being drab. It's plush rooms, with ample moulding and details, sports that famous royal blue accent in various aspects of the decor— even in the wonderful toiletries — which never goes out of style.

reviews.title: Expected better
reviews.text: One of the best aspects of hotel is its location right over the RTA Red Line Subway and the Blue, Green and Waterfront rail lines which is a single elevator ride away. You can also walk to dozens of great restaurants, including the new House of Blues, as well as take a walkway to the baseball stadium and the Gund arena, movies and a great shopping mall.

reviews.title: They can't handle a busy weekend
reviews.text: As for the signature hotel restaurant itself — the Century Grill — it has one of the best sushi bars in Ohio and one of the few places in the Midwest where you can get a soba-noodle bento brunch.

reviews.title: Fantastic Service at the Ritz Carlton, Cleveland
reviews.text: I had the opportunity the spend a night at the Ritz-Carlton Hotel in Cleveland. I was given a certificate by my boss for a job well done. When I arrived, I was treated like a "King". Frontdesk staff was fast in processing my reservation; pointing out areas of interest and what was available in the hotel. My room was very spacious and roomy; and tastefully decorated. I ordered in-room dining and I received my meal within 25 minutes. I had ordered seafood and it was delicious-as I enjoyed it with my glass of wine. I was surprised when the room attendant came in for a turn down service. The chocolates were a delite. I felt so pampered. I was told by friends that their stay at the hotel was very good. My personal rating is A+. Excellent service, interaction with hotel staff and food were all very good.

reviews.title: Great Stay at the Ritz Carlton, Cleveland
reviews.text: I had the opportunity to stay at the Ritz Carlton hotel in Cleveland this week while in town for business. The staff were very professional, friendly and helpful. I especially enjoyed the in-room dining meal of seafood that came in 20 minutes. My room was very spacious. I liked the fact that I could hook up my laptop and get some work done. I will definitely tell my friends and coworkers of my great stay at the Ritz Carlton Cleveland.

reviews.title: Simply the Best
reviews.text: This past weekend we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, Cleveland. My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary. When we pulled up to the Ritz we were immediately greeted with smiles and warm welcomes. All the staff greeted us by name and wished us a happy and relaxing anniversary. When we checked in we were surprised to find that we had been upgraded to club level. What a wonderful treat! We could not imagine a better experience until we arrived at our guest room. As soon as we walked in the door we noticed a welcome card, champagne, and roses all over the bedroom. This gesture was so romantic. That evening we dined in Century and enjoyed their clam bake. The food was excellent and the staff and presentation was flawless. I cannot imagine a better way to spend the weekend than at the Ritz-Carlton. My husband and I are already planning another stay. We would reccommend this experince to anyone. Thanks Ritz-Carlton, you are Simply the Best!!

reviews.title: A Cleveland Gem
reviews.text: As a world business traveler, and seeker of fine luxury, I do declare this fine hotel a gem.

We took advantage of the weekend "bed and breakfast retreat package" that included a deluxe king bed with large marble bath and a full breakfast for two either in the dining room or in-room service and complimentary valet parking. The rate was $259/night. We chose room service breakfast which was the highlight of the stay. Generous and tasty servings of eggs, sausage/bacon, toast/bagel/muffin, juice/coffee and fresh fruit. Quite filling!! There was even an immediate call back to check if all was in order when food arrived. The staff was professional, friendly and helpful. The Flats and Warehouse District (distination to trendy lounges and excellent restaurants) is a short, safe walk away. A large shopping mall is attached to the hotel.
reviews.title: Not as 'Ritzy' as you may think

reviews.text: The down-side was an awkward array of elevators and foyers to locate the reservation desk and also the room. The room was adequate size with very comfortable bed but felt tired with dated, powder blue carpet and gently worn furnishings. The common areas/lobby were more in keeping with the luxury expected. Overall, an above average experience and likey the best hotel in Cleveland.
reviews.title: If this is Cleveland's BEST...

reviews.text: I stayed at the Cleveland Ritz August 2nd - 4th of 2005, with my 2 teenage kids. We had come to town to see the Yankees play the Indians at the Jake. The hotel was definitely not up to 5-star standard of other major metropolitan areas. I supposedly received a non-smoking room that absolutely REEKED of smoke and cover-up spray. The rooms are in need of a refresh, and the public decor could use a spruce as well. I will say that the staff were ALL very nice, cordial and helpful, and security felt tight and omnipresent.
reviews.title: Rooms need extreme makeover
Overall a Plus
reviews.text: I chose the Ritz for a few reasons - (a) it's location to the ballpark (5 minute walk); (b) it's proxiity to the mall (hey - I was traveling with teenagers!; (c) the stay was free (I used Marriott points to pay for the stay); (d) it is the Ritz, after all!

reviews.title: loved service at fitness center
reviews.text: As I think about it, I wonder how much of my feelings about the hotel are really the hotel's fault, as opposed to the general state of Cleveland itself. It was a very dingy and depressing city. The only bright spots - the lake front area where the R&R HoF is, and the ballpark. The Ritz is in the business district, and it was absolutely QUIET in the middle of the business day. Hardly anyone around at all. Strange.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: it's hard for me to write this review - we're still here, at the "Ritz" in Cleveland, and some of the staff have been great. On a par, maybe, w/ a good Hyatt or Renaissance.
reviews.title: so much less than a ritz...or even a residence inn

reviews.text: But the hotel? Nowhere near a Four Seasons, Renaissance, The Breakers, or even a WDW "Luxury" resort. Much less a "Ritz" or even a Marriott in a serious city. And we've stayed in hotels of all those types all over the world.
reviews.title: Oasis in Downtown Cleveland

reviews.text: The food has mostly been really good. I don't want the excellent staff - Emily, Audrey, Michelle, Mary - that we have encountered to suffer.
reviews.title: Service not up to Ritz standards

reviews.text: But, seriously? A Ritz-Carlton? We chose this hotel because it appeared to be one of the best - if not the best - in the state, when we were looking for a place for our anniversary getaway. Ohio doesn't have much to offer in the way of 4 star hotels. We wouldn't choose this one again.
reviews.title: Very comfy, great staff!

reviews.text: The rooms - on the club level, the 14th floor - are tired and typical. Beds are comfy, but the decor & bathrooms are whatever. The room is no bigger or nicer or more luxurious than a Residence Inn. Internet is not included! Even on the concierge floor. Bathrooms are marble but small, crappy wallpaper, ceiling rose shower but no hand held or anything special. It feels like this hotel used to be something else, but the Ritz bought it & tried to rebrand? Or it's just a tired Ritz? Really tired.
reviews.title: As good as it gets in Cleveland!

reviews.text: One of the best in CLE. Great place for business travel. If u forget something, they have a mall onsite. And u can head to morton's right next door
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not my first trip to the Ritz in Cleveland, I must say it is on par with other Ritz Carltons, we've stayed before and were upgraded, which was great. Of course the problem is that unless you have plans, like a baseball game, football game, or the Rock and Roll hall of fame downtown Cleveland where the hotel is located is sorely lacking. The hotel is an oasis around not a whole lot except eating at the Warehouse district. Disappointing city, but the hotel can make up for it
reviews.title: great hotel, but you better have plans for the stay

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz midweek in late August. We stayed there because it was one of the few we found that allows dogs in downtown Cleveland.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but rather expensive.

description: The epitome of Midwestern hospitality and the only downtown Cleveland hotel to receive a four-star, four-diamond rating, The Ritz-Carlton, Cleveland features: ideal heart-of-downtown location; 205 well-appointed guest rooms and suites with panoramic views of the Cuyahoga River, Lake Erie, and downtown Cleveland; exceptional dining in MUSE and Lobby Lounge on 6; 24-hour Fitness Center; indoor access to Tower City Center; easy walking access to downtown attractions
